newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan sells April fuel oil at below $100/T.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan sells April fuel oil at below $100/T.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has sold by tender more than one 30,000-tonne cargo of high sulphur fuel oil for April lifting at below $100 per tonne, a company official said on Friday.
The 3.0-percent high sulphur fuel oil cargoes are for delivery April 8-26 free-on-board (fob) from Kaohsiung.
"We sold more than just one cargo although recent fuel oil prices have not been very good," the official said.
In its last tender, CPC sold three 30,000-tonne cargoes of 3.0-percent high sulphur fuel oil for March 12-28 delivery at $103 per tonne fob Kaohsiung. - Singapore Newsroom (65+870 3571)
